intro: Lithocarpus uvariifolius var. ellipticus, commonly known as the elliptic evergreen oak, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fagaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of China, Vietnam, and Myanmar. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage, with elliptic-shaped leaves that are typically leathery and glossy. It produces small, inedible nuts enclosed in a hard shell, similar to other members of the genus Lithocarpus. This species thrives in humid, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical forests.
